parameters.valve_anatomy: Bicuspid aortic valve (or other congenital valve anomaly), Aortic valve sclerosis
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Aortic Vmax <2 m/sec with normal leaflet motion

parameters.valve_anatomy: Mild to moderate leaflet calcification/fibrosis of bicuspid or trileaflet valve with some reduction in leaflet motion or Rheumatic valve changes with commissural fusion

valve_hemodynamics.mild_as: Aortic Vmax 2.0-2.9 m/sec or mean AP <20 mm Hg
valve_hemodynamics.moderate_as: Aortic Vmax 3.0-3.9 m/sec or mean AP 20-39 mm Hg

parameters.hemodynamic_consequences: Early LV diastolic dysfunction may be present

parameters.valve_anatomy: Severe leaflet calcification/fibrosis or congenital stenosis with severely reduced leaflet opening
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Severe AS: Aortic Vmax ≥4 m/sec or mean AP ≥40 mm Hg
parameters.hemodynamic_consequences: LV diastolic dysfunction, Mild LV hypertrophy
parameters.symptoms: None, Exercise testing is reasonable to confirm symptom status

parameters.definition: Asymptomatic severe AS with LV systolic dysfunction
parameters.valve_anatomy: Severe leaflet calcification/fibrosis or congenital stenosis with severely reduced leaflet opening
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Aortic Vmax ≥4 m/sec or mean AP ≥40 mm Hg

parameters.valve_anatomy: Severe leaflet calcification/fibrosis with severely reduced leaflet opening
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Aortic Vmax ≥4 m/sec or mean AP ≥40 mm Hg

parameters.definition: Symptomatic severe low-flow, low-gradient AS with reduced LVEF
parameters.valve_anatomy: Severe leaflet calcification/fibrosis with restricted leaflet motion
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Aortic Vmax <4 m/sec with resting aortic valve area ≤1.0 cm²

parameters.definition: Symptomatic severe low-gradient AS with normal LVEF or paradoxical low-flow severe AS
parameters.valve_anatomy: Severe leaflet calcification/fibrosis with restricted leaflet motion
parameters.valve_hemodynamics: Aortic Vmax <4 m/sec, stroke volume index <35 mL/m²
parameters.hemodynamic_consequences: Increased LV wall thickness, Small LV chamber with low stroke volume, Restrictive diastolic filling
